intro: Sida portosantana, commonly known as desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Sida portosantana is adapted to survive in harsh conditions with minimal water availability.
